abstract: Dispute between General Services Administration and federal Office of Management and Budget over funding for new FBI headquarters is holding up process for building single site for all FBI employees, which has been mandated by Congress; GSA cannot assess site-specific proposals or qualifications of potential developers if project does not secure funding.
lead_paragraph: While federal agencies disagree over how to pay for a new center, netting at the J. Edgar Hoover building in Washington is preventing concrete from falling onto pedestrians.

headline.main: Funding Dispute Over F.B.I. Headquarters Delays Next Step
headline.print_headline: Funding Dispute Over F.B.I. Headquarters Delays Next Step

snippet: While federal agencies disagree over how to pay for a new center, netting at the J. Edgar Hoover building in Washington is preventing concrete from falling onto pedestrians.
